body: I also have the `--debug` output if that's helpful
The debug output would be helpful. I bet it's a race condition of some delayed event populating the database after it has been cleared.
The only reliable solution: add larger time.sleeps.


This is the relevant section:

```
2013-11-05 12:47:28.980 [IPControllerApp] client::client '\x00{\xdd\x13\xc9F[\x11\xe3\x9b\xe9\x00\x18\xde\x14\x83\x0e' requested u'queue_request'

2013-11-05 12:47:28.986 [IPControllerApp] Dropping records with {u'msg_ids': u'all', u'engine_ids': []}
2013-11-05 12:47:29.017 [IPControllerApp] queue::request u'289ceeb8-34f1-452d-8909-c9321a164b7f' completed on 4
```

a task is finishing between the purge and the check, so it's not cleared.  I think I know what's going wrong, PR shortly.
Try #4506, which should fix the `_wait_for_idle` condition, which ignored the tasks that were pending in this particular test.
